caption: On google maps the museum is listed as open and on many websites it is listed as free entrance museum first sundays at the each month. I lost an hour on my off day to go there to find out it is closed. What a disrespectful way to treat the public.

The manufacturer was closed over the holidays and I was heartbroken. I literally touched the building in reverence. Gobelins has been the tapestry maker for France since approximately Louis IV. They still restore and maintain all the French antiquities that are owned by the French government. Epic. Some day I hope to visit and purchase anything, even a Keychain.

Somewhat interesting visit of a historic space, but on my visit there was a limited opportunity to ask questions as the guide was chatting with another tour guide the entire time (a trainee guide?). I'd have appreciated more explanation about why they're still making tapestries, the budget given over to this, the committee that chooses which paintings to make (and why is it always paintings?), and then a little tactile stuff like a small sample we could touch, a model loom we could interact with in a limited way, a little yarn to take home or at least touch, etc.

We arrived during posted open hours to a locked gate and absolutely no signage. Learned later then were opening an exhibit the next day, but isn‚Äôt what the internet and websites are for? They need to do better.

Small but wonderful gallery of tapestries from the Gobelin museum. Extraordinary colours and detail can be found in old and more recently woven works. Well worth  a visit and deserves to be better  known.
I love Goblins ! They make them here ! üßå ‚Ä¶
Rate average considering a 4 for the palace and a 2 for the item. But of course if you want to visit you know that you will see only very well and colourful tapestry.
Royal Textile Manufacture from the 1600's still producing fine furnishings and tapestries
Free admission. Normally, there would be artists working on new tapestries, but we visited on a day during a French holiday, so they were not there to see. Very handicap accessible.

I stumbled upon this gallery. They had a wonderful exhibit on famous painters' works converted into tapestry. I especially loved the contemporary section. The architecture of the space is great, with beautiful light and shadows on one tapestry depicting stained glass. Highly recommend!

Once royal manufacture outside of Paris is today still in function. The old artists workshops became gallery holding monumental expos under it's hight. Great for world heritage day, to peek everywhere. Amazing site.
Super interesting exhibition of modernist tapestries from their collection. Free entry. Worth visit.
Great place for a visit, and for admiring the tapestries!

Gobelins Manufactory houses some of Paris's most beautifully preserved tapestries!  It's a museum of craftsmanship that is no longer done today.  Some of these tapestries date back to the 1400's.  This incredible artistry should not be missed.  If you're in need of a quick art pick-me-up, consider the Gobelins Manufactory!  The Gobelins Manufactory avails these gorgeous tapestries to the Public for free.  Please check their schedule to fit it into yours.  It's not such a huge place, so be sure to fit it in before dinner or after lunch! üòâ
Excellent exhibition, I enjoyed it very much. Warm congratulations.
Experienced church with fantastic people.
Closed without publishing so. This is not the first time I stand outside the gobelin museum, just coming to a closed door with a printed ‚Äúferme‚Äù on the door. Arrogant. Unfriendly. Lousy service.
Guided tours only Tuesday to Thursday 1:00. Only temporary contemporary exhibitions.
Might be worth a visit if it were open to the public.
Fantastic selection of tapestries by old master Jean Lur√ßat and an insight into the process of making these time consuming works of art

Visit with my son's school. There were two workshops, colors and dyeing. A place where you learn know-how and history. Perfect for getting to know the job.

I give 3 for the adorable and professional staff. The museum is accessible to a disabled person in a wheelchair.  On the other hand, she was not able to participate in the workshop which was located further down for the schools because there were no accessible paths and too many cobblestones.

We bought tickets at full price but found no tapestries at all! Instead, they had drawings and plans for theater scenes, I think it was. It was truly a disappointing experience that I can only warn others against wasting their time and money on! We will never come back!

It is a national tapestry institute and school that preserves work techniques by combining traditional and modern methods, and strives to train experts by carrying out various projects such as restoration of cultural properties. Visit on Cultural Heritage Day

I visited the gallery during the exhibition on the renovated furniture and painted decorations of Notre-Dame de Paris cathedral. Short but exceptional exhibition. They present around twenty magnificent renovated paintings representing passages from the Bible, around ten restored tapestries recounting the life of the Blessed Virgin, models of the new liturgical furniture and the highlight of the show is the large carpet of the cathedral which is absolutely spectacular !

Very disappointing, very few tapestries on display, staged around the creations of Richard Peduzzi with some very rare pieces of furniture. No interest for the uninitiated. National furniture is located in another building and can only be visited by reservation. Many other Parisian museums are worth a detour.

The Galerie des Gobelins is currently presenting an exhibition entitled Les Grands D√©cors de Notre-Dame de Paris  The exhibition was almost empty, mainly frequented by elderly people, which could be because it is religious and classical art. However, the guided tour is highly recommended. It is affordable and above all very interesting, highlighting rarely seen works, hidden in the shadows for a long time. There have been 22 restorations, and only 15 works were visible in the church previously.  In summary, this exhibition is worth visiting to discover hidden treasures of Notre-Dame de Paris.
Very beautiful Gobelins gallery There we discover a superb exhibition of the great (restored) decorations of Notre-Dame. Not to be missed: the choir carpet of Notre-Dame de Paris Alright
